content.raw: Since we're getting rid of the `offset` variable, we can remove the comment (not even true anymore).
content.html: Since we're getting rid of the offset variable, we can remove the comment (not even true anymore).

content.raw: Maybe not an issue for this PR, but I looked at where `sec_conversion` is used here (in `_parse_parameter_file`) and we can definitely replace it with a unit conversion. We're better off figuring out how to remove these relics of 2.x entirely.
content.html: Maybe not an issue for this PR, but I looked at where sec_conversion is used here (in _parse_parameter_file) and we can definitely replace it with a unit conversion. We're better off figuring out how to remove these relics of 2.x entirely.

content.raw: Other than the two minor comments below and the need to merge again, LGTM!
content.html: Other than the two minor comments below and the need to merge again, LGTM!

content.html: Before this gets merged in we should turn on answer tests for NMSU ART

content.raw: All tests pass. Good job!
content.html: All tests pass. Good job!

content.raw: Why did this work before? Is this a dead code branch or something?
content.html: Why did this work before? Is this a dead code branch or something?

content.raw: I have no idea. I'm also pretty leery about touching too much of the code in this frontend since I don't understand most of it.
content.html: I have no idea. I'm also pretty leery about touching too much of the code in this frontend since I don't understand most of it.

content.raw: Good catch - does the linter notice these kinds of scoping issues for you?
content.html: Good catch - does the linter notice these kinds of scoping issues for you?

content.raw: Do we really not need this anymore, or the read_castro_particles cython utility function?
content.html: Do we really not need this anymore, or the read_castro_particles cython utility function?

content.raw: Yup! This specific rule is [F812](https://flake8.readthedocs.org/en/2.4.1/warnings.html).
content.html: Yup! This specific rule is F812.

content.raw:
Nope, neither of these classes are used anywhere else in the repository.

Although I've just now noticed that IOHandlerCastro is still int the docs in this PR, which I will fix right now.
content.html:
Nope, neither of these classes are used anywhere else in the repository.

Although I've just now noticed that IOHandlerCastro is still int the docs in this PR, which I will fix right now.

content.raw: So I guess support for Castro / Nyx particles is provided someplace else? Or do we not support particles for those dataset types any more? The "code support" web page says that we do.
content.html: So I guess support for Castro / Nyx particles is provided someplace else? Or do we not support particles for those dataset types any more? The "code support" web page says that we do.

content.raw: I honestly have no idea. I'm not able to load the castro or nyx example datasets on yt-project.org/data, so I guess support was dropped at some point?
content.html: I honestly have no idea. I'm not able to load the castro or nyx example datasets on yt-project.org/data, so I guess support was dropped at some point?

description:
I don't think there's anything controversial in this one.

Includes several bugfixes caught by the linter but is mostly minor style changes, removing dead code or unused variables, or removing unused imports.

I should mention that we should be able to turn on the NMSU ART answer tests once this is merged.
